body_html:
Thank @ivan-aksamentov for you quick answer!
However your solution doesn't work doesn't work in my case.. @aselle
I think Tensorflow understands that there is one Cpu on the node which is the "concatenation" of all the CPUs. That is why the I print print(device_lib.list_local_devices()) Tensorflow shows only one CPU.

Is there a Tensorflow function for checking who many CPUs are available? (like import multiprocessing;
multiprocessing.cpu_count()). I think the problem comes from there.

Or maybe it is just a path variable or some config on my server I have to change?

Offtopic: I use iTerm2 ad ZSH_THEME="avit"
Feel free to find a very good tutorial here

body:
Thank @ivan-aksamentov for you quick answer!
However your solution doesn't work doesn't work in my case.. @aselle 
I think Tensorflow understands that there is one Cpu on the node which is the "concatenation" of all the CPUs. That is why the I print print(device_lib.list_local_devices()) Tensorflow shows only one CPU.

**Is there a Tensorflow function for checking who many CPUs are available?** (like import multiprocessing;
multiprocessing.cpu_count()). I think the problem comes from there. 

Or maybe it is just a path variable or some config on my server I have to change?

Offtopic: I use iTerm2 ad ZSH_THEME="avit" 
Feel free to find a very good tutorial [here](https://gist.github.com/kevin-smets/8568070)
